intro: Euphrasia rostkoviana var. fennica, commonly known as the Fennoscandian eyebright, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to northern Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in woodland and heathland habitats. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in dense spikes. It is valued for its medicinal properties and is often used in traditional herbal remedies.
